Class SimWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimWorld

  • public class SimWorld
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all interactions between entities/ life forms. Implements collision methods and dictates what happens when specific collision events occur.

    Sets the background image of the world, and keeps track of events based on seconds elapsed. The simTicks variable is incremented at each second, then the modulus operator is used to handle timed events.

    See Also:
    simTicks variable in this class.

    • Method Detail

      • runWorldCycles

        public void runWorldCycles(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage,
                  javafx.scene.layout.VBox pane,
                  javafx.scene.layout.VBox hpane)
        Adds all entities to a Group to be added to the world. Creates the scene for the GUI and has a time line which runs cycles of the simulation indefinitely

        All timed events are handled through this method, utilising the variable simTicks. Events controlled are, for example: detecting poisoned entities, detecting collisions, removing dead entities from the world amongst other events such as breeding.

        Parameters:
        primaryStage - the stage to set the scene containing the simulation upon.
        pane - a vertical box used to handle the addition of the menubar and menu items onto the scene
        hpane - another vertical box to hold the toolbar and the toolbar buttons.

      • createWorld

        public void createWorld()
        Creates the entity objects for all pieces of the map (for example, carnivores, herbivores, dens and obstacles). This is based upon an individual number of each entity the user has previously defined when setting up the world.

      • collideHerbivores

        public void collideHerbivores(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                     javafx.scene.Group root)
        Handles the collisions necessary for herbivores in the array list to interact with other items on the map. Primarily deals with collisions on the world edges (scene width and scene height). Also deals with when a herbivore collides with one of the following: a food source; a den and an obstacle.

        Calls the move function in a life form to translate each entities position in the next frame of the animation. Sensing events are handled in the world class as they are modelled as collisions of objects in array lists.

        Parameters:
        scene - the scene possessed by the current world which is used to get world specific data.
        root - the group of all items on the map.

      • collideCarnivores

        public void collideCarnivores(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                     javafx.scene.Group root)
        Handles the collisions necessary for carnivores in the array list to interact with other items on the map. As with the herbivores, it handles collision with the world borders first, then with herbivores and obstacles.

        Calls the move function in a life form to translate each entities position in the next frame of the animation. Also handles the removal of killed entities once they have been eaten.

        Parameters:
        scene - the scene possessed by the current world which is used to get world specific data.
        root - the group of all items on the map, used to get the correct object in the group to remove upon a herbivores death

      • hasCollided

        public boolean hasCollided(javafx.scene.shape.Circle predAreaToCheck,
                  javafx.scene.shape.Circle preyAreaToCheck)
        Returns a boolean value as to whether two circles in the world have collided Works using pythagoras theorem to detect if any two given circle objects have intersected.
        Parameters:
        predAreaToCheck- - represents the first circle in the world being checked for collisions.
        preyAreaToChheck- - represents the second circle in the world being checked for collisions, usually for the object being consumed by the predator.

      • addHerbivore

        public void addHerbivore(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                javafx.scene.Group root)
        Finds the last placed herbivore in the world, creates a new herbivore and adds to the array list. Increments the number of herberivores and adds the herbivore to the group (whilst sending it to the back of the scene as to not interfere with menu controls)

      • addCarnivore

        public void addCarnivore(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                javafx.scene.Group root)
        Finds the last placed carnivore in the world, creates a new carnivore and adds to the array list. Increments the number of carnivores and adds the carnivore to the group (whilst sending it to the back of the scene as to not interfere with menu controls)

      • removeHerbivore

        public void removeHerbivore(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                   javafx.scene.Group root)
        Removes the last herbivore added to the map through any means. removes the graphical representation of the life form from the group root and deletes the last entry in the array list

      • removeCarnivore

        public void removeCarnivore(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                   javafx.scene.Group root)
        Removes the last carnivore added to the map through any means. removes the graphics for the carnivores and then removes the data of the carnivore object from the array list

      • toggleDevMode

        public void toggleDevMode()
        Sets the colour of the sense radius to a slightly translucent colour and visable to the user. Primarily used for demonstration purposes of how the simulation works. Works on a toggle basis from a radiobutton from the GUIWorld class If the toggle is off, it resets the colour to transparent so the user no longer sees it
        See Also:
        class

      • getAllLifeFormData

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllLifeFormData()
        Used to print data about lifeforms currently in the map. Used to fill a text area on the scene of the simulation.
        Returns:
        lifeFormData returns a string list of specific data from all entities in the world.
        See Also:
        of the returned list in the GUIWorld class

      • editCarnivores

        public void editCarnivores()
        Increases the energy and intelligence level of the carnivores currently in the map

      • editHerbivores

        public void editHerbivores()
        Increases the energy and intelligence level of the herbivores currently in the map

      • detectPosion

        public void detectPosion()
        For all of the life forms in the map, encircle them with red if they have been poisoned to notify the user.
        See Also:
        use of modified for loop

      • detectDeath

        public void detectDeath(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
               javafx.scene.Group root)
        Removes nodes from the group in the simulation based on certain factors. For example, if a herbivores age surpasses 200 or at any time their energy is below zero, they are removed from the map.
        Parameters:
        scene - used to hold the current scene being operated upon
        root - Group passed to the function which is used to remove the correct graphical representation of the entity which has died.

      • detectBreeding

        public void detectBreeding(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                  javafx.scene.Group root)
        Handles collisions of carnivores with other carnivores when they are ready to breed. This can occur when their breeding boolean value has been set manually or when their energy is high enough.
        See Also:
        method that sets ready to breed to true

      • forceBreeding

        public void forceBreeding(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                 javafx.scene.Group root)
        sets all life forms ready to breed despite energy levels

      • triggerDisaster

        public void triggerDisaster(javafx.scene.Scene scene,
                   javafx.scene.Group root)
        Invokes a function which removes entities from the map and changes the background image of the map. A red circle reticule is painted on the map, then a counter counts down from 5. After the countdown some entities are removed from the scene and the fill of the map background is set to a different theme.
        Parameters:
        scene - used to store the current scene the simulation is running
        root - used to add the circle reticule when the countdown begins and remove it again when the count down ends.
